Sandra TeoLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 23 Feb 2019Hi there! Just for others who are unfamiliar with the January effect, it is the theory that there is a seasonal increase in the prices of company shares during the first month of the year, the rationale behind this is that markets are inefficient and as such experience seasonal anomalies. According to an analysis by Dollars & Sense, there is no evidence of january effect but rather a reversal was observed. 0 comments0
